table.column: row or line (of people or things expected to be in motion)
Reihe (von Personen oder Gegenständen in Bewegung)
ردیف یا خط (از افراد یا مواردی که انتظار می رود در حرکت باشد) [AUTOTRANSLATED]

This would be used for a queue, i.e., a line of people waiting to get into a movie. It is expected that the row or line of people or things is (or will or might be) in motion, so that eventually it diminishes until it's gone (in contrasted to a {wIyqap:n} which is stationary). This word is used even if the people or things are bunched up. If there are two rows of people waiting to get into two side-by-side entrances, {lanSoy:n:nolink} would still be used for each of them (and not {wev:n}).[1]
The word {mIr:n:1} can be used as a slang term for this, if things are clear.[1]

table.name: mem

This was defined as "be thin" in {TKD:src} and expanded to include "be narrow" at {qep'a' 25 (2018):src}.

table.column: This is to vote in an election or to vote for a motion. It doesn't have the idiomatic sense of "express an opinion" and is only used if a formal vote is actually taken.[1]

This verb describes movement like that of a bird's wings, and not like that of a flag (for which see {joq:v}). In flight, a bird's wings {laq:v:1:nolink}, and the bird is said to {laqmoH@@laq:v:1, -moH:v} its wings.
The example comes from the KLI website and not from the {HolQeD:src} article itself.

table.name: mem
table.column: ytterligare en, en annan, en till

The suffix for the plural of this word depends on whether it is used to refer to beings capable of language (see {-pu':n:suff}), body parts (see {-Du':n:suff}), or things which are neither (see {-mey:n:suff}).

Суффикс для множественного числа этого слова зависит от того, где он использован, чтобы соотнести возможность использования его в языке(смотрите {-pu':n:suff}), для частей тела (смотрите {-Du':n:suff}), или вещей, а также чего-то другого (смотрите {-mey:n:suff}).

The English translation of the sentence from {Star Trek Constellations:src} does not appear in the book, but in the author's annotations which was a separate document. The Klingon sentence was printed with a typo in the book, a space after {qIrq:n:name}. It's clear that {-'e':n:suff} was intended since the English translation fronts "Kirk": "Kirk I want alive" (as opposed to "I want Kirk alive").

This idiomatic expression means "I don't believe you, maybe someone else will", or "That is irrelevant to me, maybe someone else will care."

table.column: People often just use a shrub when they can't find a "lav"atory.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This means to move to a slanted or angled position. The starting position is often, but doesn't have to be, upright or perpendicular. If applied to a person, it means the person's feet stay put. The pivot could be at the top, bottom, or somewhere else.
Returning to the upright (or earlier) position is {lavHa':v@@lav:v, -Ha':v}.
If the swinging is continuously back and forth, use {ler:v} instead.

table.name: mem
table.column: graus (unidade tradicional de medida de ângulo)

This is a traditional (in the sense of having been used a long time ago but no longer in use today) unit of angle. There are 243 {lawmey:n:nolink} in a {gho:n}. (Note that 243 is 3 to the 5th power.)

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a modern unit of angle adopted from other civilizations in the galaxy. It is also referred to as a {law chu':n:nolink} (although that term is used less and less). There are 360 {lawrI'mey:n:nolink} in a {gho:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: خیلی زیاد باشد، تعداد زیادی باشد [AUTOTRANSLATED]
vara många, vara talrika, vara mycket

The word {law':v:nolink} is used in comparative constructions. See {... X law' ... X puS:sen}.
For things that are measurable or quantifiable, but not necessarily countable, use {vItlh:v}.[2]

Слово {law':v:nolink} используется в сравнительных конструкциях. Смотрите {... X law' ... X puS:sen}.
Для вещей, которые являются измеримыми или исчисляемыми(последнее необязательно), используйте {vItlh:v}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column:
This construction is used to form comparatives and superlatives. The two things being compared go into the two slots. To form the superlative, {Hoch:n} is used in the second slot.[1]
Other antonym pairs may be substituted in place of {law':v} and {puS:v:1} as a form of word play, an example of intentional ungrammaticality. Such an advanced construction should be avoided unless one is very familiar with Klingon culture.[2]
To say that something is not more {X:sen:nolink} than something else, {law'be':v:nolink} and {puSbe':v:nolink} are used instead of {law':v:nolink} and {puS:v:nolink}. To say that something is as {X:sen:nolink} as something else, {law':v:nolink} is used with {law':v:nolink} (if the quality or its possession is considered positive), or {puS:v:nolink} is used with {puS:v:nolink} (if the quality or its possession is considered negative), or {law':v:nolink} is used with {rap:v} or {nIb:v} (the latter of which implies the two things being compared are exactly the same in some way). It is also possible to use {puS:v:nolink} with {rap:v} or {nIb:v}, but that carries a connotation of disparagement. To say that something is not as {X:sen:nolink} as something else, {pIm:v} is used in place of the second verb in the pair.[3]
To say that two things have the same amount of some quality, it's also possible to use {rap:v} or {nIb:v} without a {law':v:nolink}/{puS:v:nolink} construction. (See those verbs for details.)
The above constructions are typically used only to compare similar things. To form similes, which compare things which are unlike, use {rur:v} instead. When the above constructions are used to compare unlike things, they generally reference well-known similes.

Эта конструкция используется, чтобы сформировать сравнение чего-то с превосходящим. Две вещи, которые подлежат сравнению, отправляются в соответствующие слоты. Чтобы сформировать что-то превосходное, {Hoch:n} используется второй слот.[1]
Другая пара антонимов может быть заменена в месте {law':v} и{puS:v:1} как форма словесной игры.[2]
Чтобы сказать, что что-либо {X:sen:nolink} не более важно чем что-то еще, {law'be':v:nolink} и {puSbe':v:nolink} используются вместо {law':v:nolink} и {puS:v:nolink}. Чтобы сказать, что, описываемая вещь {X:sen:nolink}, походит на что-то другое, {law':v:nolink} используется вместе с {law':v:nolink} (если количество или одержимость рассматриваются с положительной стороны), или {puS:v:nolink} использован вместе с {puS:v:nolink} (если количество или одержимость рассматриваются с негативной стороны), или {law':v:nolink} использован с {rap:v} или {nIb:v} (последний из которых предполагает, что две вещи сравниваются точно также). Также возможно использовать {puS:v:nolink} вместе с {rap:v} или {nIb:v}, но это несет оттенок пренебрежения. Чтобы сказать, что что-то не является {X:sen:nolink} как что-то еще, {pIm:v} использован на месте второго глагола в паре.[3]
Чтобы сказать, что две вещи имеют одинаковое качество, также возможно использовать {rap:v} или {nIb:v} без конструкции {law':v:nolink}/{puS:v:nolink}. (Смотрите подробности по упомянутым глаголам.)
Конструкции сверху обычно используются, чтобы сравнивать похожие вещи. Чтобы сформировать сравнения для непохожих вещей, используйте {rur:v}. Когда конструкции сверху использованы для сравнения непохожих вещей, они в общем и целом относятся к хорошо известным сравнениям.

In the 1st edition of the {paq'batlh:src}, the sentence had been {SoH rallaw' law' Hoch rallaw' puS.:sen:nolink} This was changed to put the {-law':v} on the antonym pair {law':v:nolink} and {puS:v:nolink} in the 2nd edition.
comparative, comparison, superlative, more, less, most, least
[1] {TKD 6.6:src}, [2] {KGT p.178-9:src}, [3] {HQ 13.1, p.8-10, Mar. 2004:src}, [4] {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2015:src}, [5] {Smithsonian GO FLIGHT app:src}, [6] {paq'batlh 2ed p.130-131:src}

In the film "To Have and Have Not", there is a famous scene where Lauren Bacall's character asks Humphrey Bogart's character if he knows how to whistle.

table.column: The inhabitants of Lenmak use an eight-day week ({Hogh:n}).
This is a reference to John Lennon and Paul McCartney. The names of the days of the week are all references to the Beatles.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a disease caused by a bacterium. Its symptoms include high fever, weakness, and perhaps abdominal pain, headaches, and a skin rash. Klingons tend to avoid talking about it.[1]

This was requested as a native Klingon equivalent for typhoid fever.
Probably a coincidence: Lieven Lemnes was the author of "Diseases: Their Symptoms and Cures".

table.name: mem
table.column:
{leng:v:nolink} works like {jaH:v}.[2]
This word can be used to refer to traveling with or without a special purpose. If it is desired to indicate traveling on a mission, use {ve':v} instead.[3]

{leng:v:nolink} работает, как {jaH:v}.[2]
Это слово может быть использовано, чтобы упомянуть путешествие с целью или без неё. Если есть желание обозначить путешествие с целью выполнить миссию, используйте {ve':v} вместо этого.[3]

▶ {yuQ vIleng.:sen:nolink} or {yuQDaq vIleng.:sen:nolink} "I travel to the planet."[2] ▶ {yuQvo' jIleng.:sen:nolink} "I roam away from the planet."[2] ▶ {yuQDaq jIleng.:sen:nolink} "I roam around/about on the planet."[2]

▶ {yuQ vIleng.:sen:nolink} oder {yuQDaq vIleng.:sen:nolink} "Ich reise zum Planeten."[2] ▶ {yuQvo' jIleng.:sen:nolink} "Ich reise vom Planeten weg."[2] ▶ {yuQDaq jIleng.:sen:nolink} "Ich reise auf dem Planeten."[2]

▶ {yuQ vIleng.:sen:nolink} or {yuQDaq vIleng.:sen:nolink} "Я путешествую по планете."[2] ▶ {yuQvo' jIleng.:sen:nolink} "Я путешествую вдаль от планеты."[2] ▶ {yuQDaq jIleng.:sen:nolink} "Я путешествую вокруг/по планете."[2]

Это может быть применено к любой пище, к примеру {leng megh:n:nolink} "дорожный обед" (смотрите {megh:n}). Смотрите {KGT p.103:src} для более полного объяснения.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This describes the back-and-forth motion of something fixed at one end to a pivot. When applied to a person, it means the feet stay put on the ground while the body leans left and right.[1] The pivot could be at the top, bottom, or somewhere else. A rhythmic oscillation like that of a pendulum would be {lerchu':v}.[2]
For motion around a pivot in one direction only, which comes to a stop, see {lav:v}.[2]
For movement to the side without rotation or being fixed to a point, see {Dav:v:1}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the rhythmic back-and-forth motion of something fixed at one end, like a pendulum, whether the pivot is at the top, the bottom (like the inverted pendulum of a metronome), or somewhere else.
For another example where {-chu':v} on a verb of motion indicates a rhythmic pattern, see {jaDchu':v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: "Purell" is a brand of hand sanitiser.

table.name: mem
table.column: The fact that this is homophonous with {leS:v} may have to do with how many "rests" (sleeps) one gets before the day in question. Note that {Hu':n:nolink} is also homohonous with {Hu':v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a type of {HurDagh:n}. It is larger than the {Supghew:n} but smaller than the {tIngDagh:n}.
Les Paul was an American guitarist, after whom the Gibson Les Paul electric guitar was named.

table.name: mem
table.column:

This word can be used figuratively. There is an idiom, {let mInDu'Daj; Separmey rur@@let:v, mIn:n, -Du':n, -Daj:n, Separ:n, -mey:n, rur:v}.
Это слово может использоваться фигурально. Есть идиома, {let mInDu'Daj; Separmey rur@@let:v, mIn:n, -Du':n, -Daj:n, Separ:n, -mey:n, rur:v}.

table.column: This is the metallic chemical element with the symbol Hg and atomic number 80.
Dies ist das metallische chemische Element mit dem Symbol Hg und der Ordnungszahl 80.
Read backwards, this is {ngIb tel:n@@ngIb:n:1, tel:n} "ankle wings", a reference to the talaria (winged sandals) of the god Mercury.

This is actually a kind of Klingon nut, but it looks sort of like an almond. For the Terran almond, precede with {tera':n}.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: vara speciell, vara exceptionell, vara särskild
быть специальным, быть особым, быть особенным, быть исключительным, быть специфичным

table.column: 是無與倫比的、是非特異性的 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

This can be used in the sense of "general" (as opposed to specific). For example, {nav HablI' le'be'} might refer to the general or shared fax machine at the front desk of an office, as opposed to a fax machine at someone's desk.[2]

Это может быть использовано в общем смысле (как противоположность к слову специфичный, особенный и пр). Например, {nav HablI' le'be'} может относиться к общему или коллективному факсу у кого-то на столе, как противоположность факс-машине на чьем-то столе.[2]

mem
table.column: This is anyone tasked with delivering a message. In some contexts, it (or sometimes {Qun le''aq:n@@Qun:n, le''aq:n}) may be translated as "angel".[1]
{qa':n} is "spirit". The names of Biblical angels typically end in "el".

table.column: travel or move a specified or measurable distance or trajectory
eine messbare oder festgelegte Entfernung oder Strecke bereisen oder sich darauf bewegen
مسیری را طی کنید یا مسیری مشخص یا قابل اندازه گیری را جابجا کنید [AUTOTRANSLATED]
resa eller flytta ett specificerat eller mätbart avstånd eller en bana [AUTOTRANSLATED]
путешествовать или перемещаться на указанное или измеримое расстояние или траекторию [AUTOTRANSLATED]

matkustaa tai siirtyä mitattavalla tai määrätyllä etäisyydellä tai reitillä/lentoradalla

The object of this verb is the distance or range of motion. It is used with movement verbs such as {ron:v:1}.

▶ {ron SuvwI'; chorgh 'ujmey lID:sen@@ron:v:1, SuvwI':n, chorgh:n:1, 'uj:n, -mey:n, lID:v} or {chorgh 'ujmey lID SuvwI'; ron:sen@@chorgh:n:1, 'uj:n, -mey:n, lID:v, SuvwI':n, ron:v:1} "the warrior rolled (haphazardly) for eight ujes" ▶ {ron muD Duj; javmaH lawrI'mey lID:sen@@ron:v:2, muD Duj:n, jav:n:1, maH:n:2, lawrI':n, -mey:n, lID:v} "the airplane rolled 60 degrees"

table.name: mem
table.column: This is used for passengers only, and would not be used for "riding" a bicycle, for example.[3]
Tätä käytetään ajoneuvon matkustajista. Sitä ei käytetä polkupyörän ajamisesta.[3]
That this verb is used for passengers only was clarified during the Q & A session at {qep'a' 28 (2021):src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is also called {lIghonya':n:nolink}, typically by older speakers.[1, p.141-142]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is often pronounced as if it were {lIghongan:n:nolink}[1, p.141]

table.name: mem
table.column: This means to begin to sing a song (the singer is the subject and the song is the object).[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: simuler, imiter, se faire passer pour

The idea is that the subject of the verb looks or behaves like something (or someone) else or represents something (or someone) else. Like {ghet:v}, it has no connotation of fraud or anything underhanded. The object is the thing being simulated or the person being impersonated.
The lowercase "L" and uppercase "I" look alike and are often confused when Klingon is written in a sans serif typeface.
▶ {'IDnar pIn'a' lIl:sen@@'IDnar pIn'a':n, lIl:v} "he/she impersonates a wizard (non-fraudulently)"
▶ {'IDnar pIn'a' lIl:sen@@'IDnar pIn'a':n, lIl:v} "er/sie simuliert einen Zauberer (ohne Betrugsabsicht)"

table.name: mem
table.column: This is something (or someone) which looks or behaves like something (or someone) else. A {lIlwI':n:nolink} is different from a {lIw:n} since {lIw:n:nolink} implies replacement, whereas a {lIlwI':n:nolink} doesn't replace anyone or anything.

table.name: mem
table.column:
When {A:sen:nolink} and {B:sen:nolink} share {C:sen:nolink} with each other, the construction is {C lulIn A B je:sen:nolink} (or {C lIn A B je:sen:nolink} if {C:sen:nolink} is plural). In this case, the speaker is non-committal about whether {A:sen:nolink} or {B:sen:nolink} is the one who decided to do the sharing with the other.[1]
When a computer (or computer system) is online, it's said to be "sharing". See {lIn:v:2}.

Kun {A:sen:nolink} ja {B:sen:nolink} jakavat {C:sen:nolink}:n keskenään, rakenne on {C lulIn A B je:sen:nolink} (tai {C lIn A B je:sen:nolink}, jos {C:sen:nolink} on monikko). Puhuja ei ota kantaa siihen, jakaako {A:sen:nolink} {B:sen:nolink}:lle vai toisin päin.
Kun tietokone (tai tietokonejärjestelmä) on verkossa, sanotaan että se "jakaa". Katso {lIn:v:2}.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: آنلاین شوید (به شبکه رایانه وصل شوید) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
выходить в интернет (подключиться к компьютерной сети) [AUTOTRANSLATED]

aller en ligne (se connecter au réseau informatique)
This is just the application of {lIn:v:1} to a computer networking context. Klingons think of a computer (or computer system) which is online as "sharing".

On"lin"e.
The definition was not given. It's just explained that going online would use the verb {lIn:v:2,nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This idiomatic expression is not a euphemism, but is a little risque. It means that the subjects have a physical relationship of some sort.

table.column: This refers to a temporary substitute or stand-in. To denote a permanent replacement, use {qa'meH:n}.[2] To refer to something or someone which simulates or impersonates something or someone else, without replacement, see {lIlwI':n}.[4]

table.name: mem
table.column:
The cultural connotations are a bit different than the English word "concubine". In Klingon culture, everything associated with a {lIwnal:n:nolink} lacks honor, which is not necessarily the case for a (Terran) king's concubines or courtesans.
Only married people could have a partner who could be considered a {lIwnal:n:nolink}. A {lIwnal:n:nolink} could be male or female, so if it's necessary to distinguish, use {loD lIwnal:n@@loD:n, lIwnal:n} or {be' lIwnal:n@@be':n, lIwnal:n}.

Tämä viittaa avioliiton ulkopuoliseen kumppaniin. Sanalla on kielteinen merkitys ja se yhdistetään kunniattomuuteen.
Tämä sana on sukupuolineutraali. Tarvittaessa voi käyttää termejä {loD lIwnal:n@@loD:n, lIwnal:n} tai {be' lIwnal:n@@be':n, lIwnal:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This refers to hair on the upper lip.[2]
For "growing" a mustache, the verb {nargh:v:2} is used.[3]
The loach is a species of fish with barbels which look like a mustache.

{nargh lochwIj:sen@@nargh:v:2, loch:n, -wIj:n} "I'm growing a mustache."[3] {nargh lochwIj 'e' vIchaw':sen@@nargh:v:2, loch_n, -wIj:n, 'e':n, vI-:v, chaw':v} "I'm letting my mustache grow." (i.e., growing a mustache on purpose)[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: be a fraction of, make up a portion of, constitute part of
ein Teil (von etwas) sein, eine Teilmenge (von etwas) sein
بخشی از ، بخشی از تشکیل دهنده بخشی از آن را تشکیل دهید [AUTOTRANSLATED]
vara en del av, utgöra en del av
быть частью, составлять часть, составлять часть [AUTOTRANSLATED]
構成一部分，構成一部分 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
ser uma fração de, constituir uma parte de
être une fraction de, constituer une partie de, constituer une partie de [AUTOTRANSLATED]

This is used to express fractions in math.
If appropriate in a mathematical discussion, no prefix is used even if the denominator is one, even though this is a bit grammatically aberrant. (One would not say {wa' luloch wej:sen@@wa':n:num, lu-:v, loch:v, wej:n:num}.)[1]
At {qep'a' 30 (2023):src}, it was confirmed that {loch:v:nolink} phrases can be used where numbers can be used in sentences.[2]

▶ {wej loch cha':sen@@wej:n:num, loch:v, cha':n:num} "2/3" ▶ {vagh loch wej:sen@@vagh:n:1,num, loch:v, wej:n:num} "3/5" ▶ {loS loch jav:sen@@loS:n:1,num, loch:v, jav:n:1,num} "6/4" ▶ {wa' loch wej:sen@@wa':n:num, loch:v, wej:n:num} "3/1"

table.name: mem
table.column: The suffix for the plural of this word depends on whether it is used to refer to beings capable of language (see {-pu':n:suff}) or not (see {-mey:n:suff}).

Tämä sana voi viitata myös eläimiin, ja sen monikon tunnus riippuu siitä, käytetäänkö sitä viittaamaan olentoihin, jotka osaavat kieltä (katso {-pu':n:suff}), vai olentoihin, jotka eivät osaa (katso {-mey:n:suff}).

Шурин будет {loDnI' loDnal:n@@loDnI':n, loDnal:n} или {be'nI' loDnal:n@@be'nI':n, loDnal:n}.

table.column: In Klingon, "deep space" is called {logh Hop:n}, literally, "far space".[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: vezes, número de vezes (sufixo de repetição)
fois, nombre de fois (suffixe de répétition)

This is appended to a number to form an adverbial meaning that many times. For example, {wa'logh:adv} "once, one time" from {wa':n:num} "one", {cha'logh:adv} "twice, two times" from {cha':n:num} "two", and so on.

Присоединяется к числу, чтобы сформировать обстоятельственное значение. К примеру, {wa'logh:adv} "единожды, один раз" из {wa':n:num} "один", {cha'logh:adv} "дважды, два раза" from {cha':n:num} "два", и так далее.

table.name: mem
table.column: loghDaq Suvrupbogh SuvwI'pu' chaH Hoch SuvwI'pu''e'.
In space, all warriors are cold warriors.
Im Weltraum sind alle Krieger kalte Krieger.
در فضا، تمام رزمندگان جنگجوی سرد هستند. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
I rymden är alla krigare kalla förkämpare. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
在太空中，所有戰士都是冷戰士。
No espaço, todos os guerreiros são guerreiros frios.
Avaruudessa kaikki soturit ovat valmiita taistelemaan?
Dans l’espace, tous les guerriers sont des guerriers froids. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
The expression "cold war" in English refers to a conflict without actual fighting, but in which each side is prepared to begin fighting at any time.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the name of a Federation space station.
Dies ist der Name einer Raumstation der Föderation.
این نام یک ایستگاه فضایی فدراسیون است.
Det här är namnet på en av Federationens rymdstationer.
這是聯邦空間站的名稱。
Este é o nome de uma estação espacial da Federação.
Tämä on erään Liiton avaruusaseman nimi.
{SkyBox 99:src} had only the Klingon text. The English and German text come from {SkyBox 01:src} and {SkyBox 95:src}, respectively, which were just translations into those languages of the same card.

▶ {loS... qIb HeHDaq, 'u' SepmeyDaq Sovbe'lu'bogh lenglu'meH He ghoSlu'bogh retlhDaq 'oHtaH. HaDlu'meH, QuSlu'meH, SuDlu'meH lojmIt Da logh Hop Hut tengchaH. vaj loghDaq lenglaHtaH Humanpu'. veH Qav 'oH logh'e'.:sen:nolink} "It waits... on the edge of the galaxy, beside a passage to unknown regions of the universe, space station Deep Space Nine is the gateway for the exploration, intrigue and enterprise that mark the continuation of the human adventure into space - the final frontier."[1]

▶ {loS... qIb HeHDaq, 'u' SepmeyDaq Sovbe'lu'bogh lenglu'meH He ghoSlu'bogh retlhDaq 'oHtaH. HaDlu'meH, QuSlu'meH, SuDlu'meH lojmIt Da logh Hop Hut tengchaH. vaj loghDaq lenglaHtaH Humanpu'. veH Qav 'oH logh'e'.:sen:nolink} "Sie wartet... am Rande der Galaxie neben einer Durchfahrt in unbekannte Regionen des Universums. Die Raumstation Deep Space Nine ist der Ausgangspunkt für Entdeckungen, Intrigen und Unternehmungen, die immer weitere Abenteuer des Menschen im Weltraum bedeuten - die letzte Grenze."[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a line in "Lady Madonna" by The Beatles: "Thursday night your stockings needed mending." (See {paSlogh:n}.)

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the upper front of the torso.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is an extension of {logh'ob:n:1} to the front of other things, in which case the back would be {Sa'Hut:n:2} and the sides would be {reD:n:3}.[1] In this usage, the plural is formed with {-mey:n:suff}.[2]
This can apply to cars, motorcycles, space ships and the like, but not to the front of a computer screen (too flat) or a bottle (because it's round). There's an overlap with {'et:n:2h}, but whereas {'et:n:2h,nolink} refers to a 3-dimensional space, {logh'ob:n:2,nolink} refers to the surface at the front.[3]

An explanation of {logh'ob:n:2,nolink}, {Sa'Hut:n:2,nolink}, and {reD:n:3,nolink} was given during the Q & A session at {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2021:src}.
This was defined as "front". The clarification "exterior surface" was added based on the explanation.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the central processing unit of a computer.

table.name: mem
table.column: alle sein, nicht mehr da sein
vara helt borta, vara helt försvunnen, vara slut

This word is used for something that incrementally or gradually (not necessarily slowly) goes away, such as food on one's plate or dirt that one washes off of something.[2]
If a room is filled with boxes that are to be taken somewhere, and then over a short or long time, the boxes are removed, then {loj:v:nolink} could be used once there are no more boxes. If a room was full of furniture, and a person left the room and came back to find the room empty (and there was no reason to expect this to happen), then {ngab:v} might be used.[2]
This word would be appropriate to describe what happens to someone who beams away, if one is focusing on the incremental disappearance of the person. Once the person is gone, {ngab:v:nolink} might be used. People who are watching someone beam away might use {DemchoH:v@@Dem:v, -choH:v} to describe what they are seeing.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: No one eavesdrops at an open door.

هیچ کس در یک درب باز نشسته است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.column: {lojmItjaj:n:nolink} tends to be used on formal occasions, while both it and {ghInjaj:n:nolink} are used, seemingly indiscriminately, otherwise.
This refers to a line in "Being for the Benefit of Mr. Kite!" by The Beatles, which partly goes "on Saturday at Bishopsgate".

در موقعیت قرار گیرید، در یک موقعیت قرار بگیرید (مردم، حیوانات، یا هنرهای رزمی) [AUTOTRANSLATED]

The verb to use for striking a pose or stance is {much:v:3}.
▶ {lol SuvwI'; mIl'oD much:sen@@lol:v:1, SuvwI':n, mIl'oD:n, much:v:3}

table.name: mem
table.column: vara i en position, vara i ett läge, vara i en pose, vara i en

Note that there is a homophonous verb {lol:v:1} which can be applied to people or animals.
Some of the verb suffixes have a precise meaning when used with this verb, when it is applied to aircraft or spacecraft: ▶ {lolchu':v} "be in a correct attitude" ▶ {lolchu'taH:v} "maintain a correct attitude" ▶ {lolmoH:v} "maneuver (an aircraft) to be in an attitude" ▶ {loltaH:v} "maintain an attitude"
In aviation, attitude refers to an aircraft's orientation with respect to the horizon. This should not be confused with altitude, or distance to the ground.

table.name: mem
table.column: a specific position in the martial arts form Mok'bara
bestimmte Stellung in der Kampfsportart Mok'bara
یک موقعیت خاص در هنرهای رزمی Mok'bara را تشکیل می دهد [AUTOTRANSLATED]

This is an event to which the spirits of ancestors are invited.[2]

The gloss in {KGT:src} says simply "party, celebration". The definition has been changed for clarity based on the information from {KCD:src}. In {KCD:src}, Vok says, "The celebration was declared a {lopno':n:nolink}. You have invited all the spirits of our Klingon ancestors." This suggests that a {lopno':n:nolink} is a type of party or celebration, rather than a specific event.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a simple verb in its own right, and not the verb {lo':v} with the suffix {-laH:v}. It's likely that there is a historical connection to the verb plus suffix form.[2]

In Section 4.2.9 of {TKDA:src}, the explanation of {-ghach:v:suff} clearly implies that {lo'laH:v:nolink} is the verb {lo':v:nolink} plus the suffix {-laH:v:nolink}. However, the verb {lo':v:nolink} with the suffix {-laH:v:nolink} does not produce the meaning "be valuable". It's likely that {lo':v:nolink} and {lI':v:1} were mixed up while {TKD:src} was being written, as {lI'laHbe':v@@lI':v:1, -laH:v, -be':v} "cannot be useful" is basically synonymous with "be worthless", which appears as {lo'laHbe':v} in the {TKD:src} word list. Consequently, Section 4.2.9 of {TKDA:src} and the {msn:src} newsgroup message are somewhat contradictory.

There is an idiom, {lugh; Sor rur}.[2]
This is used for someone who makes a correct statement, or does something which is proper, appropriate, justified, or acceptable. That is, it means "factually correct" or "morally correct". It isn't used, for example, for a switch which is doing what it's supposed to do, for which see {mIt:v}. It also isn't used for a truthful fact or statement itself, for which see {teH:v} and {qar:v}.[3]

table.column: The Klingon sentence on {SkyBox S13:src} seems to have dropped some words, since it is ungrammatical.

table.name: mem
table.column:
The Klingon compass has three points, rather than four: {chan:n} (east), {'ev:n} (northwest), and {tIng:n} (southwest).
The areas around an object are its {Dung:n} (area above), {bIng:n} (area below), {retlh:n} (area beside), {tlhop:n:1} (front), and {'em:n} (behind). Something in an object's {retlh:n:nolink} can be on its {poS:n} (left) or its {nIH:n} (right). The area between two objects are their {joj:n} (area between). The area beyond an object is its {Hay:n:2h}.
In standard Klingon, locative nouns follow pronouns, e.g., {jIH tlhop:n:nolink} "in front of me". But in the dialect of the Sakrej region ({Sa'Qej Sep:n}), locative nouns take pronominal possessive suffixes, e.g., {tlhopwIj:n:nolink} "my area in front".[2] However, the directional nouns are an exception to this rule, and take possessive suffixes in every known dialect, e.g., {chanwIj:n:nolink} "east of me, to my east". If the full pronoun is used with a directional noun, the pronoun is emphasized, e.g., {jIH chan:n:nolink} "east of ME, to MY east".[4]
When referring to one's left and right sides, possessive suffixes are used. For example, one might say {nIHwIj ghop:n@@nIH:n, -wIj:n, ghop:n} to refer to their right hand.[5]
The points in between the three cardinal directions are {tIng chan:n:nolink}, {'ev chan:n:nolink}, and either {tIng 'ev:n:nolink} or {'ev tIng:n:nolink}. {chan:n:nolink} always comes second in such a compound.[3]

Клингонский компас имеет 3 точки: {chan:n} (восток), {'ev:n} (северо-запад), и {tIng:n} (юго-запад).
Территории вокруг объекта {Dung:n} (територия над), {bIng:n} (территория под), {retlh:n} (территория рядом), {tlhop:n:1} (спереди), и {'em:n} (позади). Объект {retlh:n:nolink} может быть {poS:n} (слева) или {nIH:n} (справа). Территория между двумя объектами их {joj:n} (территория между). Территория за пределами объекта {Hay:n:2h}.
В стандартном клингонском диалекте, локационные существительные следуют за местоимениями, {jIH tlhop:n:nolink} "передо мной". Но в диалекте региона Саркедж ({Sa'Qej Sep:n}), локационные существительные принимают местоименные притяжательные суффиксы, {tlhopwIj:n:nolink} "моя территория передо мной".[2] Тем не менее, направленные существительные являются исключением в этом правиле, и принимают притяжательные суффиксы в каждом известном диалекте, например {chanwIj:n:nolink} "к востоку от меня, ко мне на восток". Если полное местоимение использовано с направленным существительным, существительное акцентируется, {jIH chan:n:nolink} "к востоку от меня, ко мне на восток".[4]
При обращении к левой и правой сторонам используются притяжательные суффиксы. Например, можно сказать {nIHwIj ghop:n@@nIH:n, -wIj:n, ghop:n} для обозначения их правой руки. [5]
Точки между тремя основными направлениями {tIng chan:n:nolink}, {'ev chan:n:nolink}, и {tIng 'ev:n:nolink} или {'ev tIng:n:nolink}. {chan:n:nolink} всегда идут вторыми в таком соединении.[3]

▶ {veng chanDaq jIwam.:sen:nolink} "I hunt east of the city." ▶ {chan vengDaq jIwam.:sen:nolink} "I hunt in the city in the east." ▶ {veng chan yoSDaq jIwam.:sen:nolink} "I hunt in the city's east (the eastern part of the city)." ▶ {'evmajDaq jIwampu'.:sen:nolink} "I have hunted northwest of here." (Northwest is relative to the speaker's location.) ▶ {Daqvam 'ev jIwampu'.:sen:nolink} "I have hunted northwest of here." (Northwest is relative to a location indicated by the speaker, for example a point on a map.)

▶ {veng chanDaq jIwam.:sen:nolink} "Я охочусь к востоку от города." ▶ {chan vengDaq jIwam.:sen:nolink} "Я охочусь в городе на востоке." ▶ {veng chan yoSDaq jIwam.:sen:nolink} "Я охочусь в восточной части города." ▶ {'evmajDaq jIwampu'.:sen:nolink} "Я охотился к северо-западу отсюда(относительно местонахождения говорящего)." ▶ {Daqvam 'ev jIwampu'.:sen:nolink} "Я охотился к северо-западу отсюда(относительно точки, обозначенной говорящим, например на карте)."
[1] {TKDA:src}, [2] {KGT p.24:src}, [3] {s.k 1999.11.21:src} (reprinted in {HQ 8.4, p.6-8, Dec. 1999:src}), [4] {s.k 1999.12.01:src}, [5] {KLI mailing list 2015.08.05:src}

To this end, the sisters have acted against Gowron, going as far as to work with Romulan factions in order to gain power."[2]

▶ {DuraS tuq tlhIngan yejquv patlh luDub 'e' reH lunIDtaH DuraS be'nI'pu' lurSa' be'etor je. ngoQvam luchavmeH ghawran maghpu' be'nI'pu'. woQ luSuqmeH jIjpu' chaH romuluSngan'e' je.:sen:nolink} "Сёстры из дома Дюраса, Лурса и Бетор, постоянно ищут высокого положения для дома Дюраса внутри клингонского высшего совета. В конце, сёстры выступили против Гаурона, зайдя так далеко, что работали с ромуланскими группировками, чтобы усилить власть."
